intro: Codonanthe gibbosa, commonly known as the warty codonanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive warty growths on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
